contextId.occurrenceNote: "Who is the liar? Anyone who denies that Jesus is the Christ." John used a question to emphasize who liars are. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-rquestion]])
contextId.quote: τίς ἐστιν ὁ ψεύστης, εἰ μὴ ὁ ἀρνούμενος ὅτι Ἰησοῦς ... ἔστιν ὁ Χριστός
contextId.glQuote: Who is the liar but the one who denies that Jesus is the Christ?

contextId.occurrenceNote: John uses a question to teach his audience. This can be translated as a statement. Alternate translation: "He killed him because" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-rquestion]])
contextId.glQuote: Why did he kill him? Because

contextId.occurrenceNote: John uses a question to teach his audience. Alternate translation: "God's love is not in him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-rquestion]])
contextId.quote: πῶς ἡ ἀγάπη τοῦ Θεοῦ μένει ἐν αὐτῷ
contextId.glQuote: how does the love of God remain in him?

contextId.occurrenceNote: John used this question to introduce something he wanted to teach. Alternate translation: "I will tell you who overcomes the world:" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-rquestion]])
contextId.quote: τίς ἐστιν ... ὁ νικῶν τὸν κόσμον
contextId.glQuote: Who is the one who overcomes the world?
